image.altText: Masked people holding guns stand behind a group kneeling

props.synopsis: Masked gunmen have carried out "extrajudicial executions" in the streets of Gaza City as an expert claims the terror group is trying to regain control of the destroyed enclave.

title.children: Graphic footage shows Hamas executing people in the streets of Gaza

image.altText: Casey-Lee Peters looks into the camera, a bandage covers a port on her chest. There are framed photos in the background.

props.synopsis: A terminal cancer patient is told her failure to declare a UTI has voided her insurance policies, leaving her struggling to pay her mortgage and care for her children in her final days.

title.children: Terminally ill mum's life insurance cancelled after failure to declare UTI

image.altText: Peter V'landys speaking to media.

props.synopsis: The Australian Rugby League Commission has announced a 10-year ban for any NRL player who agrees to join a football competition it does not recognise.

title.children: NRL players face 10-year ban for joining rebel leagues

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: Stephen Flelli sits at a table with a drink in his hand.

props.synopsis: After vanishing without a trace, this restaurateur reappeared a year later spruiking a shiny new investment opportunity. But there's just one problem.

title.children: Chef who vanished caught selling lettuce hundreds of kilometres away

image.altText: A smiling dark-haired woman and a man, both wearing singlets in a wooden building.

props.synopsis: The inquest into the death of Kane Minion hears that investigators feared for their safety when visiting the property where the 2022 attack occurred.

title.children: Police officer drew gun on dog that killed meter reader, inquest hears

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: Deadline day of the AFL trade period has arrived, with clubs racing the clock to complete deals today. Does Zach Merrett get to Hawthorn, or Charlie Curnow to Sydney? Find out live.

title.children: Merrett 'all in' on deadline day switch as Hawks prepare another bid

image.altText: Sussan Ley during QT

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley has flagged the Coalition could be close to releasing a housing policy in the next couple of weeks. Follow live.

title.children: Liberal leader teases future housing policy announcement

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ley endorses Paterson's speech about Liberal future
Ley says she won't get in 'war of words' with Victorian premier over crime
'No point in being second most popular': Hume warns against Lib split

image.altText: boy with hat on on boat

props.synopsis: A total of six children and an adult have been charged with murder after 25-year-old Jack Westren was allegedly stabbed to death at Shellharbour.

title.children: Police charge five more children with murder over train station death

image.altText: A pic of a passport.

props.synopsis: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

title.children: US drops out of world's most powerful passport top 10 list for the first time

image.altText: People walk past the Reserve Bank head office in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's Sarah Hunter says underlying inflation was likely stronger than the RBA had anticipated last quarter, striking another blow to expectations of further interest rate cuts. The ASX is rallying. Follow live.

title.children: RBA chief economist's inflation warning dims rate cut expectations

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CBA boss to stay in top job until at least 2028
BHP says Australia must cut red tape to compete

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders mediation for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over funding he says he was offered to pay for his lawyers.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann ordered into mediation over funds for lawyers

image.altText: A close up of Michael J. Fox  smiling, wearing a black jacket and white button-up shirt

props.synopsis: The Back to the Future star has been candid about life with the degenerative neurological condition.

title.children: Actor Michael J Fox says he is hoping for an 'undramatic death'

image.altText: A happy smiling woman in her 30s with backpack a is holding a thermos mug in a lush outdoor space.

props.synopsis: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

title.children: Moving somewhere hotter or colder? This is how long it will take to adjust

image.altText: A woman up on a stage speaking into a microphone with a smile.

props.synopsis: The High Court has backed a decision by the government to refuse a temporary visa to American commentator Candace Owens Farmer, who had planned a speaking tour to Australia in 2024.

title.children: Australian court upholds decision to block visa for Candace Owens

image.altText: A young boy in a sporting team singlet plays by a river

props.synopsis: A witness at an inquest into the death of Alice Springs boy Mitchell Thomas has denied doctoring an electrical report in the wake of a fatal house fire.

title.children: Electrician denies 'witness contamination' in child house fire inquest

image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

title.children: 'Surprise' conjoined twins headed for Australia

image.altText: Aboriginal flag at Parramatta deaths in custody rally

props.synopsis: NSW Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan's rare public comment on the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners as the state records the most ever in a single year, is welcomed by the grieving family member of a man who died in prison.

title.children: Rare statement recognises 'inhumane treatment of First Nations people in jail'

image.altText: Close up of man in white shirt and dark glasses (Darren Woolley).

props.synopsis: Darren Woolley spent years sharing his expert knowledge of marketing on the web for free. Almost overnight, the world mostly stopped listening to businesses like his.

title.children: 'It's pretty brutal': Inside the businesses being strangled by AI search

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses, a light-coloured blouse and dark blazer smiles while posing for a photo in front of a leafy backdrop.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Crisafulli government is embroiled in a new "jobs for mates" claim after it appointed a Liberal National Party powerbroker to oversee the state's lead agency for disaster recovery.

title.children: 'Frankly outrageous': LNP government faces new 'jobs for mates claim'

image.altText: Man with short black hair and glasses wearing a suit and tie speaks in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: A crime and corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson has been finished, weeks away from a by-election he is expected to contest.

title.children: CCC probe into former Townsville mayor finished weeks before by-election

image.altText: a man holding drumsticks about to hit drums on a drum kit

props.synopsis: Midnight Oil is Sydney rock royalty, but the kit that stuck with the band for over 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

title.children: Why a Sydney pub rock legend's drums are heading to Melbourne

image.altText: a young person looking at the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: The court heard Darcy Schafer-Turner was "unconditionally loved by his family" as his school friend was sentenced to six-and-a-half years imprisonment.

title.children: School friend sentenced over body in cabinet dumped in NSW creek

image.altText: A flames engulf a house in a residential area.

props.synopsis: Police are still investigating the cause of a fatal house fire in Gladstone this morning.

title.children: 'Horrific' Queensland house fire claims life of woman and two children

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference.

props.synopsis: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

title.children: Was Chalmers taught a lesson in his fight over superannuation?

image.altText: A man with short dark hair in a navy suit and tie looks down at a smartphone as he walks out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The mother of an 11-year-old girl who was the victim of a Canberra man's sexual offences says his actions have had a lasting impact on her entire family.

title.children: Mother of 11yo girl says sexual offender caused trauma to whole family

image.altText: Flames coming from roof of ornate two-storey building with firehoses spraying water on fire.

props.synopsis: Two men are being questioned by police after fire destroyed a historical building in Lismore, only recently restored after the devastating 2022 floods.

title.children: Two men arrested after fire destroys 'landmark' masonic building

image.altText: A red petrol station sign shows prices for ULP at 229.9 cents per litre, sunset in the distance

props.synopsis: Industry experts say there is no excuse for wild variations in fuel prices across Australia, as calls grow for an independent investigation into the disparity.

title.children: Broome drivers are paying $2.29 per litre. Down the road it's a different story

image.altText: A smiling Australian one-day cricketer pumps her fist

props.synopsis: Megan Schutt had once planned to walk away after the ODI Women's World Cup, but the veteran seamer is now considering playing into 2026 for Australia.

title.children: Full trophy cabinet part of Schutt's cricket retirement dream

image.altText: A multi-legged, black drone mid-flight in front of a blurry helicopter silhouette

props.synopsis: Peaceful European NATO nations that support Ukraine are repeatedly being targeted by mysterious drone incursions, and experts say dozens in the past month appear to have links to Russia.

title.children: Experts say Russia is 'already waging a NATO drone war'. These maps show how

image.altText: People wave the Madagascar flag from a pickup truck driving through a crowd.

props.synopsis: The country's parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina after he fled the country in the face of growing opposition from soldiers and police.

title.children: Military announces takeover of Madagascar after president flees

image.altText: People's hands holding phones in front of a colourful social media logo.

props.synopsis: Teenagers on Instagram will be restricted to seeing PG-13 content by default and won't be able to change their settings without a parent's permission, Meta has announced.

title.children: Instagram to limit teens to PG-13 content, Meta says

image.altText: A photo of a an older woman smiling at camera with glasses and grey hair.

props.synopsis: Brian Barnes, 67, is accused of the murder of Merril Kelly, 70, whose body was found by firefighters after a grassfire near a cemetery in the small Victorian town in January.

title.children: Man pleads not guilty to murder of Quambatook woman

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The Herald Sun newspaper has defended its reporting about deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party Sam Groth and his wife as it prepares for a defamation lawsuit in the Federal Court.

title.children: Herald Sun says stories about Liberal MP Sam Groth and wife were in 'public interest'

image.altText: Gold and silver tokens resembling coins and bearing the Bitcoin logo.

props.synopsis: A Chinese national accused of being the mastermind behind one of the largest ever investment frauds has been charged in the US.

title.children: US seizes billions in bitcoin linked to 'massive' alleged scam
